owner_contact.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.general_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Used for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths (normal-class), and special-class concrete for major construction projects.

classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities such as site work and forms

end_of_life.control: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

benefits_loads_beyond_system_boundary.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process where concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere through chemical reaction with hydration products; also called reabsorption
carbonation.consideration: Not included in this EPD; recommended to consider in whole-of-life building studies per BS EN 16757:2017

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: Default background data from LCA databases used; AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804 allocation rules

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017
